skillTree.localised_description: Skullmuncha is Azhag’s wyvern - an incredibly vicious and temperamental beast that will only tolerate the Slaughterer on its back.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Azhag has no tolerance for infighting, when he issues an order the boyz must "get on wiv it" or pay with a particularly grisly death.
Tunnel bosses are Greenskins who are good at shoutin’ and hollerin’ at mobs when underground, where space and sight is an issue.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 during subterranean siege battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean intercept battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield, making sure the boyz are focused on the carnage.
You can’t trust ‘im. E’s a little bit woaah, a little bit Waaagh! Ya know? Well dodgy.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Held aloft and kept there by the rampant lunacy of their leader, Azhag's forces are all the stronger for his insane presence.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -25% for all Orc Boyz, Big 'Uns and Savage Orc infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Passive ability: "Frenzy" for all Orc Boyz, Big 'Uns and Savage Orc infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: "Stoopid gits, I sed NOWWWWW!!!!!!!"

effects.description:
Melee defence: +8 for all Orc Boyz, Big 'Uns and Savage Orc infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for all Orc Boyz, Big 'Uns and Savage Orc infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Base missile damage: +10% for Orc Arrer Boyz and Savage Orc Arrer Boyz units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Azhag's mysterious crown whispers fell plans and dastardly schemes; sometimes he understands them and passes the general gist to the Shamans in his army.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Shamans
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: There are some who whisper that the Slaughterer's wild schemes are not sufficiently Orcy. Needless to say, the crown normally lets him know so he can weed out the dissenters.

effects.description:
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for all Orc Boyz, Big 'Uns and Savage Orc infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description:
Attrition: +15% when under siege
	(enemy armies in local region)
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +24%

skillTree.localised_description: Enchanted armour and weapons, and the influence of the crown, allows Azhag to 'let go' somewhat on the battlefield!
When the crown takes control Azhag falls into a trance, his eyes cloud over and he mutters and even argues with himself…

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Orc choppas are crude and hefty blades usually swung with violent joy by their owner. A choppa in full swing can have a brutal, crunching impact on the poor fool on the receiving end.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Orcs may be stronger, but Goblins are smarter, nastier, and better-er.

skillTree.localised_description: It’s one fing to be big, but quite anuva to be strong as well!

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
A wise Boss knows how to lure the enemy into places where they can be ambushed or trapped with mobs that skulk in the tunnels below.
Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.

effects.description:
Attrition: -5% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +4%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +8%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +12%

skillTree.localised_description: Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling

skillTree.localised_description: These iron-hard gits are particularly tough and gnarly Greenskins, who - even if wounded - will be up and ready to fight before too long.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Occasionally an Orc will come along who is more "kunning" than the rest. He quickly rises in ranks as his plans end in victory.
A Boss that has the loyalty of the mobs means he doesn’t have to worry so much about "da boring stuff" like tents and bedding, as they’ll fight for him no matter what.
Being green meanz ya really mean.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Azhag is a threat like no other. What makes Azhag so unusual is his ominous iron crown, which emanates an ancient evil. It is this crown, a relic of olden days, which grants Azhag sorcerous powers.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +5 per turn
	(all armies)
Diplomatic relations: +40 with Vampire Counts and Arkhan the Black

Waaagh! has a chance to contain Wyverns
	(all armies)
Charge bonus: +7% for Orc Boar units

Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: The Crown of Sorcery was found in the ruins of Todtheim by Azhag the Slaughterer. Its malign influence has helped the Warboss carve a path of destruction throughout the Empire, for the Crown whispers advice and grants the wearer the power of Death Magic.

item_set.name: Slaughter Gear
item_set.description: "Waaagh! Magic and 'ard metal — makes all the puny gits nice and dead!"

Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +20
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: No ordinary armour would suit a Warboss such as Azhag, it had to be ‘ard - really, really ‘ard.
